title: Prohibits the idling of certain railroads in the state
summary: Prohibits the idling of certain railroads in the state; defines railroad; prohibits a railroad engine to idle for longer than ten minutes while parking, standing or stopping within five hundred feet of a residential property; authorizes the department of transportation to impose a fine for a violation and post signs; directs the department of environmental conservation to regulate train emissions.

       AN  ACT  to amend the transportation law, in relation to authorizing the
         department of transportation to prohibit idling railroads in the  city
         of  New  York;  and  to  amend  the environmental conservation law, in
         relation to railroad emissions regulations

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The transportation law is amended by adding a new section
    2  14-n to read as follows:
    3    S  14-N.  ADDITIONAL  PURPOSES  OF  THE  DEPARTMENT;  IDLING  RAILROAD
    4  ENGINES.  1. FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, THE TERM "RAILROAD" SHALL
    5  MEAN A PRIVATE OR PUBLIC  RAILROAD  OPERATING  IN  THIS  STATE  CARRYING
    6  EITHER  FREIGHT,  PASSENGERS  OR  FREIGHT  AND PASSENGERS, BUT SHALL NOT
    7  INCLUDE ANY RAILROAD OPERATED BY THE METROPOLITAN TRANSPORTATION AUTHOR-
    8  ITY OR ANY OF ITS SUBSIDIARIES.
    9    2. THE DEPARTMENT SHALL PROHIBIT A RAILROAD ENGINE TO IDLE FOR  LONGER
   10  THAN  TEN  MINUTES WHILE PARKING, STANDING, OR STOPPING WHEN WITHIN FIVE
   11  HUNDRED FEET OF ANY RESIDENTIAL PROPERTY.
   12    3. THE PROVISIONS OF SUBDIVISION TWO OF THIS SECTION SHALL  NOT  APPLY
   13  WHEN THE RAILROAD ENGINE IS PARKING, STOPPING OR STANDING IN A MUNICIPAL
   14  PARKING LOT.
   15    4. THE DEPARTMENT SHALL POST SIGNS RELATING TO PROHIBITED IDLING WHERE
   16  PRACTICABLE  AND  INCLUDE  THE MAXIMUM PENALTY THAT MAY BE IMPOSED FOR A
   17  VIOLATION OF SUBDIVISION TWO OF THIS SECTION. SUCH SIGNS SHALL BE POSTED
   18  AT OTHER APPROPRIATE LOCATIONS THROUGHOUT THE STATE,  AS  DETERMINED  BY
   19  THE  DEPARTMENT,  INCLUDING  BUT  NOT  LIMITED TO, LOCATIONS FOR WHICH A
   20  MUNICIPALITY RECEIVES A SUBSTANTIAL NUMBER OF COMPLAINTS OF IDLING RAIL-
   21  ROAD ENGINES.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04347-01-1

       A. 2069                             2

    1    5. IN ANY PROCEEDING RELATING TO A VIOLATION OF  THE  RESTRICTIONS  ON
    2  IDLING  IT  SHALL  NOT BE A DEFENSE THAT A SIGN REQUIRED BY THIS SECTION
    3  WAS ABSENT AT THE TIME OF THE VIOLATION.
    4    S  2.  The  environmental  conservation law is amended by adding a new
    5  section 19-0308 to read as follows:
    6  S 19-0308. RAILROAD EMISSIONS REGULATIONS.
    7    ON OR BEFORE SEPTEMBER FIRST, TWO THOUSAND TWELVE,  THE  COMMISSIONER,
    8  IN CONSULTATION WITH THE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION, SHALL ADOPT RULES
    9  AND  REGULATIONS  SETTING FORTH ACCEPTABLE EMISSIONS STANDARDS FOR RAIL-
   10  ROAD TRAINS OPERATING IN THIS STATE AS WELL AS  A  TIMETABLE  FOR  WHICH
   11  SUCH  RAILROAD  TRAINS  SHALL  BE  REQUIRED TO MEET SUCH STANDARDS. SUCH
   12  REGULATIONS SHALL APPLY TO EVERY RAILROAD TRAIN OPERATING IN THIS STATE.
   13  THE COMMISSIONER SHALL REVIEW AND REVISE SUCH REGULATIONS ANNUALLY AS HE
   14  OR SHE DEEMS NECESSARY.
   15    S 3. This act shall take effect on the sixtieth  day  after  it  shall
   16  have become a law. Effective immediately, the addition, amendment and/or
   17  repeal  of  any  rule  or regulation necessary for the implementation of
   18  this act on its effective date are authorized and directed  to  be  made
   19  and completed on or before such effective date.
